metadata.title: CVE-2016-0639 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.6.29 and earlier and 5.7.11 andearlier allows remote attackers to affect confidentiality, integrity, andavailability via vectors related to Pluggable Authentication.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0639` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-client - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-server - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.13-0ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.13-0ubuntu4').
